description: Borrowed from French coupelle, from Medieval Latin cūpella, diminutive of Latin cūpa (“cask”).

entries.meaning: A small circular receptacle used in assaying gold or silver with lead.

verbs.description: cupel (third-person singular simple present cupels, present participle cupelling or cupeling, simple past and past participle cupelled or cupeled)

entries.meaning: To refine by means of a cupel.
